shows.title: Responding to Climate Emergency: Resilience
shows.desc:
In this session we’ll explore how we face up to climate emergency. How do we mourn what has already been lost, and transform the fear of what is to come into resilience, and begin to work out ways of living together in times of crisis?

Dr Anna Fisk is an academic, theologian and Extinction Rebellion Scotland activist who writes on the intersection of religion and culture.

shows.title: Responding to Climate Emergency: Resistance
shows.desc:
This session considers the complex theological elements of ‘resistance’ through non-violent direct action. This includes how righteous anger and love interrelate, how direct action enacts a certain form of hope, and the problematic aspects of sacrifice in non-violent resistance.

Dr Anna Fisk is an academic, theologian and Extinction Rebellion Scotland activist who writes on the intersection of religion and culture.

shows.title: Responding to Climate Emergency: Restoration
shows.desc:
To combat the climate crisis, we need to make profound changes to our society. What if we thought of these as restoration rather than relinquishment? We’ll explore how reacting to climate and ecological crises involves reconnecting with nature and the material world.

Dr Anna Fisk is an academic, theologian and Extinction Rebellion Scotland activist who writes on the intersection of religion and culture.
